data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: certainty, surely, of a certainty, to be sure/certain, to ascertain, one who is certain.
data.sentence: The word يُوقِنُونَ comes from the root ي ق ن and is associated with the meanings: certainty, surely, of a certainty, to be sure/certain, to ascertain, one who is certain.
The word مِنَ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word وَمَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word لِقَوْمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word أَحْسَنُ comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: Sought for or after, desired, endeavored to find and take and get (good or evil)Loving or affecting a thingActing wrongfully, injuriously or tyrannicallySeeking or endeavoring to act corruptingly, wrongly and/or unjustly, insolent/disobedientExceeding due bounds or just limits in any wayNot right, proper or fitProstitute or adulteress, unchaste [e.g. 19:20, 19:28, 24:33]Not seeking what one should not seekSeeking game or preyPlace where a thing is sought, way or manner in which a thing is sought
data.sentence: The word يَبْغُونَ comes from the root ب غ ي and is associated with the meanings: Sought for or after, desired, endeavored to find and take and get (good or evil)Loving or affecting a thingActing wrongfully, injuriously or tyrannicallySeeking or endeavoring to act corruptingly, wrongly and/or unjustly, insolent/disobedientExceeding due bounds or just limits in any wayNot right, proper or fitProstitute or adulteress, unchaste [e.g. 19:20, 19:28, 24:33]Not seeking what one should not seekSeeking game or preyPlace where a thing is sought, way or manner in which a thing is sought

data.meanings: To be ignorant, not know of a thing, to be silly or foolish, boil vehemently, pretend ignorance, feign ignorance, reckon or esteem someone, cause commotion or unsteadiness, display wrong conduct, to be void of knowledge, believe a thing to be different from what it is in reality, do a thing in a manner different from that in which it ought to be done, proceed without knowledge, to ignore a thing, to be pagan.
data.sentence: The word الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ comes from the root ج ه ل and is associated with the meanings: To be ignorant, not know of a thing, to be silly or foolish, boil vehemently, pretend ignorance, feign ignorance, reckon or esteem someone, cause commotion or unsteadiness, display wrong conduct, to be void of knowledge, believe a thing to be different from what it is in reality, do a thing in a manner different from that in which it ought to be done, proceed without knowledge, to ignore a thing, to be pagan.

data.meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
data.sentence: The word أَفَحُكْمَ comes from the root ح ك م and is associated with the meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.

data.meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
data.sentence: The word حُكْمًا comes from the root ح ك م and is associated with the meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
